alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Interesting philosophy ['science' can here be substituted] is rarely an examination of the pros and cons of a thesis. Usually it is, implicitly or explicitly, a contest between an entrenched vocabulary which has become a nuisance and a half-formed new vocabulary which vaguely promises great things."

- Richard Rorty, Contingency, irony, and solidarity, 1989
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Interesting Science is About Competing Vocabularies
